Title: Strategic Procurement Manager - POS & Event
RoleDescription:
SUPPLIER MANAGEMENT
In this role, you will identify, qualify, and develop suppliers according to the dedicated product category, ensuring alignment with our overarching category strategy. You will develop and execute supplier-specific strategies to optimize performance and maintain a competitive edge. A key responsibility will be to ensure state-of-the-art sustainability knowledge and proactive practices within your supply base, driving our commitment to environmental stewardship. You will perform comprehensive supplier performance management, conducting thorough due diligence to maintain high standards. Additionally, you will actively manage supplier risks, introducing and overseeing risk mitigation plans to safeguard our supply chain integrity. STRATEGIC & TACTICAL PROCUREMENT
You will develop and implement strategic sourcing plans for POS & Event materials, ensuring that our sourcing initiatives align with broader business objectives. Your responsibilities will include identifying, evaluating, and selecting suppliers to guarantee the best value, quality, and reliability for our products. You will negotiate contracts, terms, and prices with suppliers, securing favorable agreements that benefit the company. Leading the full tender process from project briefing documentation to the final supplier decision, you will ensure a competitive and transparent bidding process that achieves optimal results. Your expertise will be critical in driving cost efficiencies and enhancing supplier relationships to support our business growth. CATEGORY MANAGEMENT
You will implement, execute, and monitor defined category strategies within your supply base, ensuring alignment with overall company goals and objectives. This involves continuous analysis and optimization of sourcing practices to maintain competitive advantage. By closely collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure that category strategies are effectively integrated and executed. ESG
Furthermore, you will ensure Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) compliance to required standards by closely collaborating with Red Bull's Procurement Governance function. This entails staying abreast of the latest ESG regulations and best practices, integrating these standards into supplier agreements and sourcing processes. By maintaining rigorous compliance, you will contribute to Red Bulls commitment to ethical practices and corporate social responsibility, enhancing our reputation and minimizing risk. Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Business, Engineering, or a related field.
